summary: This is an email chain between two individuals, likely within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, forwarding a message from an unknown civilian regarding the Epstein case. The forwarded message contains a contract offer, and the sender notes the individual is not a victim or witness.

persons.name: Eric
persons.role: Recipient of email (likely a prosecutor or official)
persons.context: Addressed in an email from 'Alex' regarding civilian contacts related to the Epstein case.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: Sent an email to Eric forwarding two emails from an unknown individual referencing the Epstein case, noting the individual is not a victim or witness.

connections.description: Colleagues within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, with Alex informing Eric about a civilian contact regarding the Epstein case.

events.title: Civilian Contact Regarding Epstein Case
events.description: An unknown individual sent two emails to Alex, an AUSA, referencing the Epstein case. Alex determined the individual was not a victim or witness.

events.title: Forwarding of Civilian Contact
events.description: An email was sent forwarding the earlier message about the civilian contact to Eric, likely for awareness or follow-up.

keyFacts: An Assistant U.S. Attorney (Alex) received unsolicited emails from an unknown individual referencing the Epstein case in August 2019.
The AUSA assessed that the individual was not a victim or witness in the case.
The correspondence was forwarded internally to another official (Eric) for awareness.
The forwarded attachment was titled 'SC1S Contract Offer.msg', suggesting the civilian contact may have involved a contractual proposal.
This document shows the U.S. Attorney's Office was monitoring and vetting external communications related to the Epstein investigation.
